triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio at Maximum Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio is at the maximum allowable limit for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Verify the applicant's income and consider additional affordability checks.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, Tier C applicants must have a DTI ratio of 35% or less. The applicant's DTI ratio is exactly at this threshold, indicating a potential affordability risk.

triageFlags.title: Credit Score in Sub-Prime Range
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score places them in the sub-prime category, requiring stricter lending criteria.
triageFlags.recommendation: Ensure compliance with stricter lending criteria for sub-prime applicants.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy categorizes a credit score of 619 as Tier C (Sub-Prime), which necessitates stricter lending criteria, including a minimum deposit requirement.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio is at the maximum allowable limit for their credit tier, and their credit score is in the sub-prime range, necessitating stricter lending criteria. Additional income verification is recommended to ensure affordability.
